course.title: Everyday Life in Nazi Germany
course.description: This seminar will examine the experiences of those Germans defined as "Aryan" in the Third Reich, that is, those not directly persecuted by the regime. How did they adjust (or not adjust) to the changes brought to everyday life by the Nazi regime? How did their behaviors and attitudes change in ways that helped or hindered the regime and its racial agenda? How would we define the boundaries of collaboration or consent within this society? Readings will explore aspects of German society under Nazism including the experiences of young people and women, consumption, popular culture, and the question of terror.
